bug.author: abhaygk
bug.summary: TensorFlow Architecture low level intro link broken
bug.description:
Link: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/extend/architecture>https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/extend/architecture</denchmark-link>
In the above link, an introduction link is provided. Its broken. <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/guide/low_level_intro>https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/guide/low_level_intro</denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/guide/extend/architecture.md>https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/guide/extend/architecture.md</denchmark-link> is the file to change if you want to submit a PR to fix it. The other link in the paragraph is broken also <denchmark-code>This document describes the system architecture that makes this combination of scale and flexibility possible. It assumes that you have basic familiarity with TensorFlow programming concepts such as the computation graph, operations, and sessions. See [this document](../guide/low_level_intro.md) for an introduction to these topics. Some familiarity with [distributed TensorFlow](../deploy/distributed.md) will also be helpful. </denchmark-code>
I think the first link should be ../low_level_intro.md and the 2nd link should be ../../deploy/distributed.md
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/abhaygk>@abhaygk</denchmark-link> , this was fixed last Friday. Can you verify and close?
